solution_line_template: For the {greta_hours_worked} hours worked, Greta earned a total of {greta_hours_worked} * {greta_hourly_rate} = $<<{greta_hours_worked}*{greta_hourly_rate}={greta_total_earnings}>>{greta_total_earnings}.

To find how many hours Lisa has to work to earn ${greta_total_earnings}, we divide {greta_total_earnings} / {lisa_hourly_rate} = <<{greta_total_earnings}/{lisa_hourly_rate}={lisa_hours_needed}>>{lisa_hours_needed}
